sn8.8:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery, together with a large Saṅgha of 1,250 mendicants.
sn8.8:1.2: Now at that time the Buddha was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk about extinguishment.
sn8.8:1.3: And those mendicants were paying attention, applying the mind, concentrating wholeheartedly, and actively listening.
sn8.8:1.5: “The Buddha is educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk about extinguishment.
sn8.8:1.6: And those mendicants are paying attention, applying the mind, concentrating wholeheartedly, and actively listening.
sn8.8:1.7: Why don’t I extoll him in his presence with fitting verses?”
sn8.8:2.1: Then Venerable Vaṅgīsa got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha, and said,
sn8.8:2.2: “I feel inspired to speak, Blessed One! I feel inspired to speak, Holy One!”
sn8.8:2.3: “Then speak as you feel inspired,” said the Buddha.
sn8.8:2.4: Then Vaṅgīsa extolled the Buddha in his presence with fitting verses:
sn8.8:3.3: as he teaches the immaculate Dhamma,
sn8.8:3.4: extinguishment, fearing nothing from any quarter.
sn8.8:4.1: They listen to the immaculate Dhamma
sn8.8:4.2: taught by the fully awakened Buddha;
sn8.8:4.4: at the fore of the mendicant Saṅgha,
sn8.8:5.3: You are like a great cloud
sn8.8:6.2: out of desire to see the teacher.
sn8.8:7.1: “Vaṅgīsa, had you previously composed these verses, or did they spring to mind in the moment?”
sn8.8:7.2: “They sprang to mind in the moment, sir.”
sn8.8:7.3: “Well then, Vaṅgīsa, speak some more spontaneously inspired verses.”
sn8.8:7.4: “Yes, sir,” replied Vaṅgīsa. Then he extolled the Buddha with some more spontaneously inspired verses, not previously composed:
sn8.8:8.3: See him, the liberator from bonds, unattached,
sn8.8:9.1: You have explained in many ways
sn8.8:9.2: the path to cross the flood.
sn8.8:9.3: The Seers of Truth stand unfaltering
sn8.8:10.1: As the bringer of light who has pierced the truth,
sn8.8:10.2: you’ve seen what lies beyond all realms.
sn8.8:10.3: When you saw and realized this for yourself,
sn8.8:10.4: you taught it first to the group of five.
sn8.8:11.1: When the Dhamma has been so well taught,
sn8.8:11.2: how could those who know it be negligent?
sn8.8:11.3: That’s why, being diligent, we should always train
